CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: By judicious selection of the donor and the acceptor units , the D-A copolymer architecture enables engineering of the electronic structure including energy levels of the highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) , the energy band gap , and light harvesting properties as well as charge transport properties.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| D-A copolymer |
| donor units |
| acceptor units |
| HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital) |
| LUMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital) |
| energy band gap |
| light harvesting properties |
| charge transport properties |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Of course! Here are the valid "Material Name" entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| D-A copolymer |
| HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital) |
| LUMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital) |

I removed the following entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name":

* "donor units" and "acceptor units" - these are not material names, but rather terms used to describe the structure of the copolymer.
* "energy band gap" - while this term could potentially be a material name, it is not explicitly referred to as such in the paragraph.
* "light harvesting properties" and "charge transport properties" - these are not material names, but rather properties of materials that are mentioned in the context of the D-A copolymer.
